sentence.Network_en: The company has had to make redundancy payments of £472 million.
sentence.Network_cn: 该公司不得不为裁员支付4.72亿英镑的补偿款。

sentence.Network_en: The term "early retirement" is nearly always a euphemism for redundancy nowadays.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在“提前退休”几乎就是裁员的委婉说法。

sentence.Network_en: It is absurd to be discussing compulsory redundancy policies for teachers.
sentence.Network_cn: 讨论针对教师的强制裁员政策真是滑稽可笑。

entry.def: When there are redundancies, an organization tells some of its employees to leave because their jobs are no longer necessary or because the organization can no longer afford to pay them.

example.ex: The ministry has said it hopes to avoid compulsory redundancies.
example.tran: 该部称希望避免强制性裁员。

example.ex: Thousands of bank employees are facing redundancy as their employers cut costs...
example.tran: 雇主削减成本的时候，数千名银行雇员面临被解雇的命运。

example.ex: The company has had to make redundancy payments of £472 million.
example.tran: 该公司不得不为裁员支付4.72亿英镑的补偿款。

means.word_mean: 1. repetition of messages to reduce the probability of errors in transmission
2. the attribute of being superfluous and unneeded;

sentences.sentence: "the use of industrial robots created redundancy among workers"

means.word_mean: 3. (electronics) a system design that duplicates components to provide alternatives in case one component fails

stems_affixes.value_cn: 统治权,支配力量;权势,优势

buoy浮标,浮筒+ancy物品,性质,状况→n.浮力
e出+leg=lig选+ancy物品,性质,状况→好的,高雅的→优雅;优美
pregn余+ancy物品,性质,状况→n.怀孕,丰富

vac空+ancy物品,性质,状况→n.空白,空缺

sentences.en: Redundancy notices have been sent to 200 workers.
sentences.cn: 200 名工人接到了裁员通知。

sentences.en: Sixty workers at a clothing factory face redundancy because the firm is relocating.
sentences.cn: 由于公司搬迁，服装厂有60名工人面临裁汰。

sentences.en: The threat of redundancy was suddenly removed.
sentences.cn: 裁员的威胁顿时消除了。
